Identification_Area.title: IMAGER FOR MARS PATHFINDER for MPFL

Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model
Updated schema version. LIDVID references updated to be LID references. Adding missing "investigation" references. Adding missing "agency" references. Description updated.

External_Reference.reference_text: Cook, R., P. Katemeyn, and C. Salvo, Mars Pathfinder Project Mission Plan, JPL Document 11355, PF-100-MP-02, 90 pp., 1995.

Crowe, D.G., P.H. Smith, J.D. Weinberg, N. Chabot, G. Hoppa, R. Tanner, R. Reid, K. Herkenhoff, C. Shinohara, D.T. Britt, M. Burkland, S. Hviid, H.P. Gunnlaugsson, W. Goetz, N. Thomas, R. Marcialis, T. Friedman, L. Doose, R. Reynolds, J.N. Head, J. Wellman, B. Bos, and J. Maki, Imager for Mars Pathfinder Calibration Report, Lunar and Planetary Laboratory, University of Arizona, April 11, 1997.

Smith, P.H., M.G. Tomasko, D. Britt, D.G. Crowe, R. Reid, H.U. Keller, N. Thomas, F. Gliem, P. Rueffer, R. Sullivan, R. Greeley, J.M. Knudsen, M.B. Madsen, H.P. Gunnlaugsson, S.F. Hviid, W. Goetz, L.A. Soderblom, L. Gaddis, and R. Kirk, The Imager for Mars Pathfinder Experiment, J. Geophys. Res., 102, 4003-4025, 1997.

Instrument.name: IMAGER FOR MARS PATHFINDER
Instrument.description: The Imager for Mars Pathfinder or IMP is a stereo imaging system with color capability provided by twenty-four selectable filters for the two camera channels. It is derived from the descent imager/spectral radiometer (DISR) instrument aboard the Cassini Huygens probe.
